required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage System for Embolic PROTECTion in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage System for Embolic PROTECTion in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation (PROTECT AF)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, prospective, randomized study, stratified by center, comparing the WATCHMAN device to long term warfarin therapy, demonstrating that the treatment arm is non-inferior to the control arm. This study was amended to allow for a non-randomized arm and increased enrollment.

detailed_description.textblock: The WATCHMAN device is designed to be permanently implanted distal to the ostium of the left atrial appendage (LAA) to trap potential emboli before they exit the LAA.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite of Stroke, Systemic Embolism and Cardiovascular or Unexplained Death
primary_outcome.description: A Bayesian model allowed for sequential evaluation of the primary endpoints, event rates reported per 100 patient-years (calculated as 100*N events/Total patient-years)

primary_outcome.measure: The Occurrence of Life-threatening Events, Including Device Embolization or Serious Bleeding Events
primary_outcome.description: Serious bleeding events evaluated by the Clinical Events Committee included pericardial effusion requiring drainage, cranial bleeding events due to any source, gastrointestinal bleeds requiring transfusion, and any bleeding related to the device or procedure that necessitates an operation.

secondary_outcome.description: Implant procedure success is defined as the delivery and release of a WATCHMAN Device into the LAA.

arm_group.description: Implant of WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage Closure Technology
Subjects are treated with current standard of care Oral Anticoagulation Therapy with Warfarin
Implant of WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage Closure Technology. Up to 3 non-randomized subjects per site, these subjects were not included in the primary analysis.

intervention.intervention_name: WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage Closure Technology
intervention.description: Implant of WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage Closure Technology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has paroxysmal, persistent or permanent non-valvular atrial fibrillation (AF)
- Eligible for long term warfarin
- CHADS score >= 1 [congestive heart failure (CHF), history of high blood pressure, 75 years of age or older, diabetes, prior stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA)]
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindicated for warfarin
- Contraindicated for aspirin or clopidogrel (Plavix)
- Congestive heart failure (CHF) Class 4
- Implanted mechanical valve
- Atrial septal or Patent Foramen Ovale (PFO) device
- Platelets < 100,000 or hemoglobin < 10
- Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 30%

group.title: Roll-in
group.description: Investigational centers were allowed up to 3 roll in subjects before initiating the randomization phase

group.title: WATCHMAN
group.description: Randomized to receive implantation of the WATCHMAN left atrial appendage (LAA) closure Technology

baseline.population: 2:1 randomazation, outcome analysis excludes the 93 subjects in the Roll-in arm

group.description: WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage Closure Technology:

group.title: Warfarin Control
group.description: Subjects were treated with current standard of care Oral Anticoagulation Therapy with Warfarin

group.title: Roll-in
group.description: Subjects received WATCHMAN Left Atrial Appendage Closure Technology but were not included in the outcome analysis

outcome.title: Composite of Stroke, Systemic Embolism and Cardiovascular or Unexplained Death
outcome.description: A Bayesian model allowed for sequential evaluation of the primary endpoints, event rates reported per 100 patient-years (calculated as 100*N events/Total patient-years)
outcome.population: event rates reported per 100 patient-years (calculated as 100*N events/Total patient-years) total patient years 2717, 95% Credible Intervals per predefined Bayesian Statistics Roll-in subjects were not included in the primary outcome analysis per study design.

group.description: Subjects are treated with current standard of care Oral Anticoagulation Therapy with Warfarin Warfarin: Subjects receive warfarin

measure.title: Composite of Stroke, Systemic Embolism and Cardiovascular or Unexplained Death
measure.description: A Bayesian model allowed for sequential evaluation of the primary endpoints, event rates reported per 100 patient-years (calculated as 100*N events/Total patient-years)
measure.population: event rates reported per 100 patient-years (calculated as 100*N events/Total patient-years) total patient years 2717, 95% Credible Intervals per predefined Bayesian Statistics Roll-in subjects were not included in the primary outcome analysis per study design.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The posterior probability of non-inferiority is defined as the probability that the event rate for the Device group is less than twice that for the Control group. This probability was required to be greater than 0.975 for a finding of non-inferiority. The criterion for non-inferiority was consistently met at each analysis time point demonstrating the Device group is non-inferior to the Control group.
analysis.estimate_desc: Relative Risk calculated as Device Rate over Control rate, with 95% Credible Intervals

outcome.title: The Occurrence of Life-threatening Events, Including Device Embolization or Serious Bleeding Events
outcome.description: Serious bleeding events evaluated by the Clinical Events Committee included pericardial effusion requiring drainage, cranial bleeding events due to any source, gastrointestinal bleeds requiring transfusion, and any bleeding related to the device or procedure that necessitates an operation.
outcome.population: Event rates reported per 100 patient-years (calculated as 100*N events/Total patient-years) total patient years 2717, 95% Credible Intervals per predefined Bayesian Statistics Roll-in subjects were not included in the primary outcome analysis per study design.

outcome.description: Implant procedure success is defined as the delivery and release of a WATCHMAN Device into the LAA.
outcome.population: 14 subjects did not have an implant procedure attempted

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
